bhive.hive moduleÂ¶

class bhive.hive.Hive(node='', rpcuser=None, rpcpassword=None, debug=False, data_refresh_time_seconds=900, **kwargs)Â¶

Bases: object

Connect to the Hive network.

Parameters

  • node (str) â Node to connect to (optional)

  • rpcuser (str) â RPC user (optional)

  • rpcpassword (str) â RPC password (optional)

  • nobroadcast (bool) â Do not broadcast a transaction! (optional)

  • unsigned (bool) â Do not sign a transaction! (optional)

  • debug (bool) â Enable Debugging (optional)

  • keys (array, dict, string) â Predefine the wif keys to shortcut the wallet database (optional)

  • wif (array, dict, string) â Predefine the wif keys to shortcut the wallet database (optional)

  • offline (bool) â Boolean to prevent connecting to network (defaults to False) (optional)

  • expiration (int) â Delay in seconds until transactions are supposed to expire (optional) (default is 30)

  • blocking (str) â Wait for broadcasted transactions to be included in a block and return full transaction (can be âheadâ or âirreversibleâ)

  • bundle (bool) â Do not broadcast transactions right away, but allow to bundle operations. It is not possible to send out more than one vote operation and more than one comment operation in a single broadcast (optional)

  • appbase (bool) â Use the new appbase rpc protocol on nodes with version 0.19.4 or higher. The settings has no effect on nodes with version of 0.19.3 or lower.

  • num_retries (int) â Set the maximum number of reconnects to the nodes before NumRetriesReached is raised. Disabled for -1. (default is -1)

  • num_retries_call (int) â Repeat num_retries_call times a rpc call on node error (default is 5)

  • timeout (int) â Timeout setting for https nodes (default is 60)

  • use_sc2 (bool) â When True, a hiveconnect object is created. Can be used for broadcast posting op or creating hot_links (default is False)

  • hiveconnect (HiveConnect) â A HiveConnect object can be set manually, set use_sc2 to True

  • custom_chains (dict) â custom chain which should be added to the known chains

Three wallet operation modes are possible:

  • Wallet Database: Here, the hivelibs load the keys from the locally stored wallet SQLite database (see storage.py). To use this mode, simply call Hive() without the keys parameter

  • Providing Keys: Here, you can provide the keys for your accounts manually. All you need to do is add the wif keys for the accounts you want to use as a simple array using the keys parameter to Hive().

  • Force keys: This more is for advanced users and requires that you know what you are doing. Here, the keys parameter is a dictionary that overwrite the active, owner, posting or memo keys for any account. This mode is only used for foreign signatures!

If no node is provided, it will connect to default nodes of http://geo.hive.pl. Default settings can be changed with:

hive = Hive(<host>)

where <host> starts with https://, ws:// or wss://.

The purpose of this class it to simplify interaction with Hive.

The idea is to have a class that allows to do this:

>>> from bhive import Hive
>>> hive = Hive()
>>> print(hive.get_blockchain_version())

This class also deals with edits, votes and reading content.

Example for adding a custom chain:

from bhive import Hive
hv = Hive(node=["https://mytstnet.com"], custom_chains={"MYTESTNET":
    {'chain_assets': [{'asset': 'HBD', 'id': 0, 'precision': 3, 'symbol': 'HBD'},
                      {'asset': 'HIVE', 'id': 1, 'precision': 3, 'symbol': 'HIVE'},
                      {'asset': 'VESTS', 'id': 2, 'precision': 6, 'symbol': 'VESTS'}],
     'chain_id': '79276aea5d4877d9a25892eaa01b0adf019d3e5cb12a97478df3298ccdd01674',
     'min_version': '0.0.0',
     'prefix': 'MTN'}
    }
)
broadcast(tx=None)Â¶

Broadcast a transaction to the Hive network

Parameters

tx (tx) â Signed transaction to broadcast

property chain_paramsÂ¶
claim_account(creator, fee=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Claim account for claimed account creation.

When fee is 0 HIVE a subsidized account is claimed and can be created later with create_claimed_account. The number of subsidized account is limited.

Parameters

  • creator (str) â which account should pay the registration fee (RC or HIVE) (defaults to default_account)

  • fee (str) â when set to 0 HIVE (default), claim account is paid by RC

clear()Â¶
comment_options(options, identifier, beneficiaries=[], account=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Set the comment options

Parameters

  • options (dict) â The options to define.

  • identifier (str) â Post identifier

  • beneficiaries (list) â (optional) list of beneficiaries

  • account (str) â (optional) the account to allow access to (defaults to default_account)

For the options, you have these defaults::

{
    "author": "",
    "permlink": "",
    "max_accepted_payout": "1000000.000 HBD",
    "percent_hive_dollars": 10000,
    "allow_votes": True,
    "allow_curation_rewards": True,
}
connect(node='', rpcuser='', rpcpassword='', **kwargs)Â¶

Connect to Hive network (internal use only)

create_account(account_name, creator=None, owner_key=None, active_key=None, memo_key=None, posting_key=None, password=None, additional_owner_keys=[], additional_active_keys=[], additional_posting_keys=[], additional_owner_accounts=[], additional_active_accounts=[], additional_posting_accounts=[], storekeys=True, store_owner_key=False, json_meta=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Create new account on Hive

The brainkey/password can be used to recover all generated keys (see bhivegraphenebase.account for more details.

By default, this call will use default_account to register a new name account_name with all keys being derived from a new brain key that will be returned. The corresponding keys will automatically be installed in the wallet.

Warning

Donât call this method unless you know what you are doing! Be sure to understand what this method does and where to find the private keys for your account.

Note

Please note that this imports private keys (if password is present) into the wallet by default when nobroadcast is set to False. However, it does not import the owner key for security reasons by default. If you set store_owner_key to True, the owner key is stored. Do NOT expect to be able to recover it from the wallet if you lose your password!

Note

Account creations cost a fee that is defined by the network. If you create an account, you will need to pay for that fee!

Parameters

  • account_name (str) â (required) new account name

  • json_meta (str) â Optional meta data for the account

  • owner_key (str) â Main owner key

  • active_key (str) â Main active key

  • posting_key (str) â Main posting key

  • memo_key (str) â Main memo_key

  • password (str) â Alternatively to providing keys, one can provide a password from which the keys will be derived

  • additional_owner_keys (array) â Additional owner public keys

  • additional_active_keys (array) â Additional active public keys

  • additional_posting_keys (array) â Additional posting public keys

  • additional_owner_accounts (array) â Additional owner account names

  • additional_active_accounts (array) â Additional acctive account names

  • storekeys (bool) â Store new keys in the wallet (default: True)

  • creator (str) â which account should pay the registration fee (defaults to default_account)

Raises

AccountExistsException â if the account already exists on the blockchain

create_claimed_account(account_name, creator=None, owner_key=None, active_key=None, memo_key=None, posting_key=None, password=None, additional_owner_keys=[], additional_active_keys=[], additional_posting_keys=[], additional_owner_accounts=[], additional_active_accounts=[], additional_posting_accounts=[], storekeys=True, store_owner_key=False, json_meta=None, combine_with_claim_account=False, fee=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Create new claimed account on Hive

The brainkey/password can be used to recover all generated keys (see bhivegraphenebase.account for more details.

By default, this call will use default_account to register a new name account_name with all keys being derived from a new brain key that will be returned. The corresponding keys will automatically be installed in the wallet.

Warning

Donât call this method unless you know what you are doing! Be sure to understand what this method does and where to find the private keys for your account.

Note

Please note that this imports private keys (if password is present) into the wallet by default when nobroadcast is set to False. However, it does not import the owner key for security reasons by default. If you set store_owner_key to True, the owner key is stored. Do NOT expect to be able to recover it from the wallet if you lose your password!

Note

Account creations cost a fee that is defined by the network. If you create an account, you will need to pay for that fee!

Parameters

  • account_name (str) â (required) new account name

  • json_meta (str) â Optional meta data for the account

  • owner_key (str) â Main owner key

  • active_key (str) â Main active key

  • posting_key (str) â Main posting key

  • memo_key (str) â Main memo_key

  • password (str) â Alternatively to providing keys, one can provide a password from which the keys will be derived

  • additional_owner_keys (array) â Additional owner public keys

  • additional_active_keys (array) â Additional active public keys

  • additional_posting_keys (array) â Additional posting public keys

  • additional_owner_accounts (array) â Additional owner account names

  • additional_active_accounts (array) â Additional acctive account names

  • storekeys (bool) â Store new keys in the wallet (default: True)

  • combine_with_claim_account (bool) â When set to True, a claim_account operation is additionally broadcasted

  • fee (str) â When combine_with_claim_account is set to True, this parameter is used for the claim_account operation

  • creator (str) â which account should pay the registration fee (defaults to default_account)

Raises

AccountExistsException â if the account already exists on the blockchain

custom_json(id, json_data, required_auths=[], required_posting_auths=[], **kwargs)Â¶

Create a custom json operation

Parameters

  • id (str) â identifier for the custom json (max length 32 bytes)

  • json_data (json) â the json data to put into the custom_json operation

  • required_auths (list) â (optional) required auths

  • required_posting_auths (list) â (optional) posting auths

Note

While reqired auths and required_posting_auths are both optional, one of the two are needed in order to send the custom json.

hive.custom_json("id", "json_data",
required_posting_auths=['account'])
finalizeOp(ops, account, permission, **kwargs)Â¶

This method obtains the required private keys if present in the wallet, finalizes the transaction, signs it and broadacasts it

Parameters

  • ops (list, GrapheneObject) â The operation (or list of operations) to broadcast

  • account (Account) â The account that authorizes the operation

  • permission (string) â The required permission for signing (active, owner, posting)

  • append_to (TransactionBuilder) â This allows to provide an instance of TransactionBuilder (see Hive.new_tx()) to specify where to put a specific operation.

Note

append_to is exposed to every method used in the Hive class

Note

If ops is a list of operation, they all need to be signable by the same key! Thus, you cannot combine ops that require active permission with ops that require posting permission. Neither can you use different accounts for different operations!

Note

This uses Hive.txbuffer() as instance of bhive.transactionbuilder.TransactionBuilder. You may want to use your own txbuffer

property hbd_symbolÂ¶

hbd_to_rshares(hbd, not_broadcasted_vote=False, use_stored_data=True)Â¶

Obtain the r-shares from HBD

Parameters

  • hbd (str, int, amount.Amount) â HBD

  • not_broadcasted_vote (bool) â not_broadcasted or already broadcasted vote (True = not_broadcasted vote). Only impactful for very high amounts of HBD. Slight modification to the value calculation, as the not_broadcasted vote rshares decreases the reward pool.

hbd_to_vote_pct(hbd, hive_power=None, vests=None, voting_power=10000, not_broadcasted_vote=True, use_stored_data=True)Â¶

Obtain the voting percentage for a desired HBD value for a given Hive Power or vesting shares and voting power Give either Hive Power or vests, not both. When the output is greater than 10000 or smaller than -10000, the HBD value is too high.

Returns the required voting percentage (100% = 10000)

Parameters

  • hbd (str, int, amount.Amount) â desired HBD value

  • hive_power (number) â Hive Power

  • vests (number) â vesting shares

  • not_broadcasted_vote (bool) â not_broadcasted or already broadcasted vote (True = not_broadcasted vote). Only impactful for very high amounts of HBD. Slight modification to the value calculation, as the not_broadcasted vote rshares decreases the reward pool.

property hive_symbolÂ¶

get the current chains symbol for HIVE (e.g. âTESTSâ on testnet)

hp_to_hbd(hp, voting_power=10000, vote_pct=10000, not_broadcasted_vote=True, use_stored_data=True)Â¶

Obtain the resulting HBD vote value from Hive power

Parameters

  • hive_power (number) â Hive Power

  • voting_power (int) â voting power (100% = 10000)

  • vote_pct (int) â voting percentage (100% = 10000)

  • not_broadcasted_vote (bool) â not_broadcasted or already broadcasted vote (True = not_broadcasted vote).

Only impactful for very big votes. Slight modification to the value calculation, as the not_broadcasted vote rshares decreases the reward pool.

post(title, body, author=None, permlink=None, reply_identifier=None, json_metadata=None, comment_options=None, community=None, app=None, tags=None, beneficiaries=None, self_vote=False, parse_body=False, **kwargs)Â¶

Create a new post. If this post is intended as a reply/comment, reply_identifier needs to be set with the identifier of the parent post/comment (eg. @author/permlink). Optionally you can also set json_metadata, comment_options and upvote the newly created post as an author. Setting category, tags or community will override the values provided in json_metadata and/or comment_options where appropriate.

Parameters

  • title (str) â Title of the post

  • body (str) â Body of the post/comment

  • author (str) â Account are you posting from

  • permlink (str) â Manually set the permlink (defaults to None). If left empty, it will be derived from title automatically.

  • reply_identifier (str) â Identifier of the parent post/comment (only if this post is a reply/comment).

  • json_metadata (str, dict) â JSON meta object that can be attached to the post.

  • comment_options (dict) â JSON options object that can be attached to the post.

Example:

comment_options = {
    'max_accepted_payout': '1000000.000 HBD',
    'percent_hive_dollars': 10000,
    'allow_votes': True,
    'allow_curation_rewards': True,
    'extensions': [[0, {
        'beneficiaries': [
            {'account': 'account1', 'weight': 5000},
            {'account': 'account2', 'weight': 5000},
        ]}
    ]]
}
Parameters

  • community (str) â (Optional) Name of the community we are posting into. This will also override the community specified in json_metadata.

  • app (str) â (Optional) Name of the app which are used for posting when not set, bhive/<version> is used

  • tags (str, list) â (Optional) A list of tags to go with the post. This will also override the tags specified in json_metadata. The first tag will be used as a âcategoryâ. If provided as a string, it should be space separated.

  • beneficiaries (list) â (Optional) A list of beneficiaries for posting reward distribution. This argument overrides beneficiaries as specified in comment_options.

For example, if we would like to split rewards between account1 and account2:

beneficiaries = [
    {'account': 'account1', 'weight': 5000},
    {'account': 'account2', 'weight': 5000}
]
Parameters

  • self_vote (bool) â (Optional) Upvote the post as author, right after posting.

  • parse_body (bool) â (Optional) When set to True, all mentioned users, used links and images are put into users, links and images array inside json_metadata. This will override provided links, images and users inside json_metadata. Hashtags will added to tags until its length is below five entries.

property prefixÂ¶
refresh_data(force_refresh=False, data_refresh_time_seconds=None)Â¶

Read and stores hive blockchain parameters If the last data refresh is older than data_refresh_time_seconds, data will be refreshed

Parameters

  • force_refresh (bool) â if True, a refresh of the data is enforced

  • data_refresh_time_seconds (float) â set a new minimal refresh time in seconds

rshares_to_vote_pct(rshares, hive_power=None, vests=None, voting_power=10000, use_stored_data=True)Â¶

Obtain the voting percentage for a desired rshares value for a given Hive Power or vesting shares and voting_power Give either hive_power or vests, not both. When the output is greater than 10000 or less than -10000, the given absolute rshares are too high

Returns the required voting percentage (100% = 10000)

Parameters

  • rshares (number) â desired rshares value

  • hive_power (number) â Hive Power

  • vests (number) â vesting shares

  • voting_power (int) â voting power (100% = 10000)

set_password_storage(password_storage)Â¶

Set the password storage mode.

When set to ânoâ, the password has to be provided each time. When set to âenvironmentâ the password is taken from the UNLOCK variable

When set to âkeyringâ the password is taken from the python keyring module. A wallet password can be stored with python -m keyring set bhive wallet password

Parameters

password_storage (str) â can be ânoâ, âkeyringâ or âenvironmentâ

sign(tx=None, wifs=[], reconstruct_tx=True)Â¶

Sign a provided transaction with the provided key(s)

Parameters

  • tx (dict) â The transaction to be signed and returned

  • wifs (string) â One or many wif keys to use for signing a transaction. If not present, the keys will be loaded from the wallet as defined in âmissing_signaturesâ key of the transactions.

  • reconstruct_tx (bool) â when set to False and tx is already contructed, it will not reconstructed and already added signatures remain

vote(weight, identifier, account=None, **kwargs)Â¶

Vote for a post

Parameters

  • weight (float) â Voting weight. Range: -100.0 - +100.0.

  • identifier (str) â Identifier for the post to vote. Takes the form @author/permlink.

  • account (str) â (optional) Account to use for voting. If account is not defined, the default_account will be used or a ValueError will be raised

witness_set_properties(wif, owner, props, use_condenser_api=True)Â¶

Set witness properties

Parameters

  • wif (str) â Private signing key

  • props (dict) â Properties

  • owner (str) â witness account name

Properties::

{
    "account_creation_fee": x,
    "account_subsidy_budget": x,
    "account_subsidy_decay": x,
    "maximum_block_size": x,
    "url": x,
    "hbd_exchange_rate": x,
    "hbd_interest_rate": x,
    "new_signing_key": x
}
